alert.note: Alert for Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Misty Fjords; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 2:26PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... The long tap of Pacific moisture streaming northeastward up from Hawaii, which is often described as an atmospheric river, will continue to shift slowly southward across the central and southern Alaskan Panhandle tonight. This will result in periods of moderate to sometimes heavy rainfall through Sunday morning before diminishing. Observations across the area show about 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen so far today. An additional 1 to 2 inches of rain is expected through tomorrow morning. While the additional totals of rainfall tonight are not expected to result in significant flooding across the southern Panhandle, with creeks and streams already rising from rainfall today, we should be on the lookout for some minor flooding issues near already swollen creeks and streams from rain and snowmelt. A break in the heavier precipitation is expected later on Sunday.

area.areaDesc: Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Misty Fjords; Southern Inner Channels
